intro: Balaniella alutacea, commonly known as the small-leafed balaniella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, hairy fruits. Balaniella alutacea is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
